data.title: Tickets and Passes Ferrari Museums
data.meta_description: Buy tickets for visiting Ferrari Museums in Modena and Maranello, guided museum tours and special packages on the official Ferrari box office.
data.text:
Maranello

The free parking (P4), reserved for museum visitors, is in Via Madonna del Sagrato, bordering the Fiorano track. Open from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m., it also includes a free shuttle service to and from the Ferrari Museum of Maranello available from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. and from 2 to 7 p.m.

The municipal car park in the plaza opposite the entrance to the Museum has around 50 parking spaces. Charge: 1€/per hour 9.00 - 12.00 / 14.00 – 18.00

There are also many other parking spaces – some free, others requiring parking disc or payment – in the area around the Museum.

You can also get to the Museum from the car park at via Claudia 234 (parking disc, 90 minutes) – just follow the “Strada della Storia Ferrari” pedestrianised street for about 300 metres.

Modena

Two free car parks (P1 and P2) at the rear of the Museum, on via Giuseppe Soli 101, are available while spaces last.

There are also many other parking spaces – some free, others requiring parking disc or payment – in the area around the Museum.

Coach/bus parking

Maranello

Coaches and buses may drop off and pick up guests at the plaza in front of the Museum but cannot park there for more than 15 minutes.

There are three different coach parks just a few minutes away for Ferrari Museum-dedicated buses and drivers. They must remain in the coach park apart from picking up and dropping off passengers. All drivers must park in one of the following three coach parks:

P1 Coach park, Via Michele Alboreto / Bus Terminus (charge applies)

P2 Coach park, Via Giuseppe Farina intersection with Via Bandini Lorenzo (free/except for second Sunday of every month when market is held)

P3 Coach park, Via Ignazio Giunti (free)

Modena

Coaches can drop off and pick up passengers in the Museum carpark but cannot park for more than 15 minutes.
